snippet: Balwant Bains was at the center of the issues facing multicultural Britain, including the perennial question of balancing religious precepts and cultural identity against assimilation.
abstract: Balwant Bains, former principal of British public school made up mostly of Muslim students, gives first interview since stepping down in face of relentless criticism from Muslim-dominated school board; Bains's experience has helped illustrate highly contentious conflicts unearthed by government investigation into whether organized groups of conservative Muslims were having undue influence on public schools.
lead_paragraph: Balwant Bains was at the center of the issues facing multicultural Britain, including the perennial question of balancing religious precepts and cultural identity against assimilation.

headline.main: A Sikh Principal, Too English for a Largely Muslim School
headline.print_headline: British Principal Who Resigned Believes He Was Seen as a Threat

keywords.value: Saltley School and Specialist Science College
keywords.name: organizations
